intro: Linaria arvensis subsp. simplex, commonly known as the simple devil's-bit cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of yellow or orange-red flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Linaria arvensis subsp. simplex is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
